results.title: Street kids
results.creator_credit: York St Film Productions, Film Victoria, Kent Chadwick, Leigh Tilson and Rob Scott
results.brief_description: A documentary about homeless youths, some as young as 10, surviving by any means on the streets of Melbourne. Various young people are interviewed about their situation and their search for jobs and accommodation. Highlights the frustrations they face and the resultant temptation to fall into crime and prostitution in order to survive. Police and social workers who deal with these young people from day to day comment on the situation and how they attempt to alleviate the despair of those they encounter. Use of voice-overs (street kids talking about their lives) is very effective as well as disturbing. A courageous and compelling documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: York St Film Productions, Film Victoria, Kent Chadwick, Leigh Tilson and Rob Scott

results.title: Magic lantern set effects slide (Man and lions)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a man fights between two lions set against a black background. Made by Lawler, 161 Strand, London. ‘91’ written in pencil on wooden frame. Cream tape has been adhered to the edge of the sliding section.

results.title: Patsy Comes To Stay
results.brief_description:
Kenneth Carruthers Rankine (1890 - 1968) was a keen amateur cinematographer and filmmaker. This collection of his home movies has been donated to ACMI by Kenneth’s granddaughter. The collection represents a wonderful slice of life in Australia; with contents including scenes of everyday life, major family occasions, holidays around Victoria and views of Melbourne.

This film is a silent comedy narrative entitled ‘Patsy Comes to Stay’, which was produced by the Victorian Amateur Cine Society. The film was directed by H.J.D. Law and features Rankine as the Chief of Police.

results.title: Endoscopic Vanitas (No Veins Version)
results.material_description: skull, endoscopic cameras, mechanised mount, transformer, fog machine and projection
results.brief_description:
“Endoscopic Vanitas (No Veins Version)” is a reworking of a past work, originally exhibited in 2009 at the Venice Biennale, commissioned for the exhibition “Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences”.

In the centre of the room a single human skull hangs suspended by a metal frame. An endoscopic camera moves inside the skull, a second explores its exterior. The images captured by the two cameras are projected onto separate screens, the first a mist screen that sits at the entrance to the room creating a permeable barrier to the cavernous space behind, the second a simple LCD screen inside the room. These images appear abstract, suggestive, lunar. Gladwell is playing with the time-honoured trope of the momento mori, as well as with Plato’s ‘allegory of the cave’.

results.title: Flames of love on the ice
results.creator_credit: Deng Yuan and Beijing Salon Films
results.brief_description:
Roller skating expert Lin Jia Jun is involved in a traffic accident which forces him into prison as a result of killing a Hong Kong traveller. Soon after coming out of prison and returning to his garage, he encounters the dead traveller’s widow Zhao Ya Yi. The two of them develop from misunderstanding to affectionate feelings towards each other. However, Lin Jia Jun fails to realize that the traveller was an important member of the Hong Kong Mafia, who before passing away hid a stash of drugs which triggered his Hong Kong associates into hiring a professional killer to deal with the business in the Mainland. He attacks during Lin and Zhao Ya Yi’s wedding, and in the crossfire Zhao Ya Yi is brutally murdered, and Lin Jia Jin decides to help the Mainland police as they have been keeping the Mafia gang under surveillance. As soon as the Mafia gang shatters into Lin’s garage Lin Jia Jun, disregarding his own safety, takes the gang on, until the Mainland police make their entrance from the roof and annihilate the gang.
(Awards: Golden Rooster 1991 - Editing).
(Wendy Xu, 2014).

results.title: Tucker
results.brief_description: Highlights the importance of good food habits. The importance of early experiences is emphasized, together with the valuable role of the school canteen and the teachers who promote good eating habits using the basic five food groups.

results.title: Our fragile coast: The Coast, a question of balance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and David Hughes
results.brief_description: The first half of this compilation tape focuses on erosion and deposition at Port Campbell, the Gippsland Lakes and Port Phillip, to be used in conjunction with the Earth in Action topic of the Year 12 Geography course; the second shows how competing human interests could destroy the coastal ecology.

results.title: Billabong
results.brief_description: Set among the red gums, this film captures the mood of one day on the Murray River, Echuca, Victoria. Shows where thousands of birds come to breed each year.
